fr.upmc.components.connectors

Interface DataConnectorI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, ConnectorI, DataOfferedI.PushI, DataRequiredI.PullI, RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataConnector, ActiveDataConnector, DataConnector, NGenerator2UGeneratorConnector

    public interface DataConnectorI
extends ConnectorI, DataRequiredI.PullI, DataOfferedI.PushI
    The interface BasicDataConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others.

    Description

    When components exchange data rather than calling services from each others, the offering component is considered as the producer of data while the requiring one is considered as the consumer. And the two interfaces are assumed to be developed independently, the data interfaces in the required and the offered interfaces need not be the same. The connector is therefore responsible for the implementation of translating methods to and from.

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      disconnect a requiring component from an offering one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).
      DataRequiredI.DataI offered2required(DataOfferedI.DataI d)
      translate data as defined by the offered interface into data as defined in the required interface.
      void reconnectServer(OfferedI offering, RequiredI requiring)
      disconnect and connect anew a requiring component to an offering one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).
      DataOfferedI.DataI required2offered(DataRequiredI.DataI d)
      translate data as defined by the required interface into data as defined in the offered interface.

      • connectServer

        void connectServer(OfferedI offering,
                 RequiredI requiring)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        connect an offering component to a requiring one, taking care only of the server port (when the client-side is remote).

        Contract

         pre    offering != null && requiring != null
 pre    offering instanceof DataOfferedI.PullI
 pre    requiring instanceof DataRequiredI.PushI
 pre    !this.connected()
 post   ((PortI) offering).connected()
        Parameters:
        offering - in port of the component implementing the offered interface.
        requiring - out port of the component requiring the required interface.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

 post   offering.connected()
